definition: to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to return to one's true self/to regain the natural state
see 返璞歸真|返璞归真[fan3 pu2 gui1 zhen1]

sentences.english: The marriage was to last until Khadijah died.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻持续到赫蒂杰归真。

sentences.english: His problem is that of the complicated man recovering his original simplicity.
sentences.chinese: 他的问题是一个变得复杂了的人如何返璞归真的问题。

sentences.english: Back to Basics. This is the New Traditional Style.
sentences.chinese: 返璞归真，这是新的传统风格。

sentences.english: But the Prophet passed away before the coming of the next year.
sentences.chinese: 但在来年之前穆圣就归真了。

sentences.english: I think we are getting back to basics.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我们都返朴归真。

sentences.english: What people pursue nowadays is simplicity and nature, isn't it?.
sentences.chinese: 现代人不就追求反朴归真吗？简单就是美。

sentences.english: The birthplace of kindergarten is returning to its roots.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿园的诞生地正在走上返朴归真的道路。

sentences.english: At her death, she was buried outside Makkah in a grave dug by the Prophet himself.
sentences.chinese: 她归真后，葬在麦加外穆圣亲自挖的一个坟墓里。

sentences.english: The pure and simple style of this restaurant's decoration is really unique.
sentences.chinese: 这家饭店的装饰反璞归真，很有特色。

sentences.english: Sometimes, though, simple tools like this are exactly what it takes to bring usback to the basics.
sentences.chinese: 但有时正是这些简单工具让我们返璞归真。

sentences.english: His problem was that of the complicated man seeking simplicity.
sentences.chinese: 他的问题是一个复杂的人如何返朴归真。

sentences.english: The aim of precepts, admonished believers the good and evil, leaving comments on basics.
sentences.chinese: 其目的在于教诫，劝诫教徒们为善止恶，弃妄归真。

sentences.english: He wants to give away all his modern possessions and return to nature.
sentences.chinese: 他要舍弃一切时髦的东西而归真返璞。
我个人意见是返朴归真。

definition: to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
oneness of heaven and humanity/the theory that man is an integral part of nature
Buddha-like heart (full of compassion)/spirit of Buddha (awakened to reality and no longer clinging to appearances)
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
to enter the Way/to become a Daoist
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle/Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond/also pr. [Da4 cheng2]
Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
